thread.title: Monkey clings to its mother after she is electrocuted | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Monkey clings to its mother after she is electrocuted | Daily Mail Online

author: Kelly Mclaughlin For Mailonline
title: Monkey clings to its mother after she is electrocuted | Daily Mail Online
text: Monkey clings to its mother after she is electrocuted by overhead power cables, only for the young animal to survive when it is thrown clear by blast and CAUGHT by hero standing underneath A howler monkey, called Ashley, was just two weeks old when she was orphaned Her mother was electrocuted by a transformer in Playa Guiones, Costa Rica Little Ashley was on her mum's back when her mother tried to help her older son who came dangerously close to the transformer Rescuers were able to deter her son who fled to safety but it was too late for Ashley's mother who was electrocuted The shock sent Ashley falling from her mum's back, but rescuers managed to catch the baby, who escaped with only minor burns
